info.title: Trivial Buzz
info.description: JSON API serving roughly 200,000 trivia questions from the popular gameshow, Jeopardy! spanning 1984 - 2012. This project is unaffiliated with the Jeopardy! gameshow and claims no ownership of the questions. Questions were obtained by crawling www.j-archive.com . This is a project developed in my free time using Ruby on Rails on the backend and Swagger for documentation. An API key is not required. See more at https://github.com/abd00s/trivial-buzz Ensure proper pointing to endpoints `/api/ [version e.g. v1] /[endpoint] .json` for example `www.trivialbuzz.com/api/v1/search.json?query=abdullah`

get.description: Returns a single question by ID.</br> **question**:</br>      **id**: Question ID</br>      **body**: Jeopardy! clue</br>      **response**: Jeopardy! answer</br>      **value**: Question dollar value; Final Jeopardy questions have 0 value</br>      **category**: Category of question</br>          **id**: Category ID</br>          **name**: Category name</br>          **url**: link to category</br>      **from_round**: Information on round in which question appeared</br>          **id**: Round ID</br>          **name**: Jeopardy!, Double Jeopardy! or Final Jeopardy!</br>          **url**: link to round</br>          **from_show**: Information on show in which round appeared</br>              **id**: Show ID</br>              **show_number**: Jeopardy! show number</br>              **air_date**: Date the show aired YYYY-MM-DD</br>              **url**: link to show
get.summary: Retrieve a single question by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of question to fetch

get.description: Returns a random question.</br> **question**:</br>      **id**: Question ID</br>      **body**: Jeopardy! clue</br>      **response**: Jeopardy! answer</br>      **value**: Question dollar value; Final Jeopardy questions have 0 value</br>      **category**: Category of question</br>          **id**: Category ID</br>          **name**: Category name</br>          **url**: link to category</br>      **from_round**: Information on round in which question appeared</br>          **id**: Round ID</br>          **name**: Jeopardy!, Double Jeopardy! or Final Jeopardy!</br>          **url**: link to round</br>          **from_show**: Information on show in which round appeared</br>              **id**: Show ID</br>              **show_number**: Jeopardy! show number</br>              **air_date**: Date the show aired YYYY-MM-DD</br>              **url**: link to show

parameters.name: newer_than
parameters.description: Lower bound to search from (YYYY-MM-DD), starting from 1984-09-10 [Optional]

parameters.name: older_than
parameters.description: Upper bound to search to (YYYY-MM-DD), up to 2012-01-27 [Optional]

parameters.name: value_equals
parameters.description: Limit results to questions with this value; May not be used with value_greater or value_less. For Final Jeopardy! (or tiebreaker) questions, enter value 0. [Optional]

parameters.name: value_greater
parameters.description: Limit results to questions with value greater than (or equal to) this value [Optional]

parameters.name: value_less
parameters.description: Limit results to questions with value less than (or equal to) this value excluding questions with value of zero [Optional]

get.description: Returns paginated questions.</br> **questions**: Array containing questions</br>      **id**: Question ID</br>      **body**: Jeopardy! clue</br>      **response**: Jeopardy! answer</br>      **value**: Question dollar value; Final Jeopardy questions have 0 value</br>      **category**: Category of question</br>          **id**: Category ID</br>          **name**: Category name</br>          **url**: link to category</br> **meta**: Information on pages</br>      **current_page**: Current page</br>      **next_page**: Next page, if available</br>      **prev_page**: Previous page, if available</br>      **total_pages**: Total number of pages</br>      **total_count**: Total number of Question objects

parameters.name: newer_than
parameters.description: Lower bound to search from (YYYY-MM-DD), starting from 1984-09-10 [Optional]

parameters.name: older_than
parameters.description: Upper bound to search to (YYYY-MM-DD), up to 2012-01-27 [Optional]

parameters.name: value_equals
parameters.description: Limit results to questions with this value; May not be used with value_greater or value_less. For Final Jeopardy! (or tiebreaker) questions, enter value 0. [Optional]

parameters.name: value_greater
parameters.description: Limit results to questions with value greater than (or equal to) this value [Optional]

parameters.name: value_less
parameters.description: Limit results to questions with value less than (or equal to) this value excluding questions with value of zero [Optional]

get.description: Use to retrieve a single round by ID. </br> _Explanation of response attributes_</br> **round**</br>      **id**: ID of round</br>      **name**: Jeopardy!, Double Jeopardy! or Final Jeopardy!</br>      **from_show**: Information about show where this round appeared</br>          **id**: ID of show</br>          **show_number**: Jeopardy! show number</br>          **air_date**: Date the show aired YYYY-MM-DD</br>          **url**: Link to show</br>      **categories**: Array of categories appearing in round</br>          **id**: ID of category</br>          **name**: Category name</br>          **url**: Link to category</br>      **questions**: Array of questions appearing in round</br>          **id**: ID of question</br>          **body**: Jeopardy! clue</br>          **response**: Jeopardy! answer</br>          **value**: Question dollar value; Final Jeopardy questions have 0 value</br>          **url**: Link to question</br>          **category**: Category of question</br>              **id**: ID of category</br>              **name**: Category name</br>              **url**: link to category
get.summary: Retrieve a single round by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of round to fetch.

get.description: Search across questions and categories</br> _Explanation of response attributes_</br> **meta**: Object explaining results and pages</br>      **query**: Search term</br>      **category_count**: Number of categories matching query</br>      **question_count**: Number of questions matching query</br>      **current_page**: Current page</br>      **next_page**: Next page, if available</br>      **prev_page**: Previous page, if available</br>      **total_pages**: Total number of pages</br>      **total_count**: Total number of search results</br> **results**: Array containing results; Note: results are either a Question or a Category</br>      **result_type**: Question or Category</br>      **id**: Question/Category ID</br>      **name**: Name of category (Only shows when result type is Category)</br>      **questions_count**: Number of questions having this category (Only shows when result type is Category)</br>      **category**: Category of question (Only shows when result type is Question)</br>          **id**: Category ID</br>          **name**: Category name</br>          **url**: Link to category</br>      **body**: Jeopardy! clue (Only shows when result type is Question)</br>      **response**: Jeopardy! answer (Only shows when result type is Question)</br>      **value**: Question dollar value; Final Jeopardy questions have 0 value (Only shows when result type is Question)</br>      **url**: Link to question or category

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search term or phrase.

parameters.name: only
parameters.description: Limit results to either questions or categories only. Valid values are `Question` and `Category` [Optional]

get.description: Returns all categories paginated with 10 per page.</br> **categories**: Array containing categories</br>      **id**: Category ID</br>      **name**: Category name</br>      **url**: Link to category</br>      **questions_count**: Number of questions having this category</br>          Note that this only includes shows revealed during the show</br> **meta**: Information on pages</br>      **current_page**: Current page</br>      **next_page**: Next page, if available</br>      **prev_page**: Previous page, if available</br>      **total_pages**: Total number of pages</br>      **total_count**: Total number of Category objects

parameters.name: popular
parameters.description: Limits results to X most popular categories. [Optional]

parameters.name: minimum
parameters.description: Limits results to categories with at least this number of questions. [Optional]

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Go to particular page. [Optional]

get.description: Fetch category by ID.</br> **category**</br>      **id**: Category ID</br>      **name**: Category name</br>      **questions_count**: Number of questions having this category</br>          Note that this only includes shows revealed during the show</br>      **shows**: Array of shows in which this category appeared</br>          **id**: Show ID</br>          **show_number**: Jeopardy! show number</br>          **air_date**: Date the show aired YYYY-MM-DD</br>          **url**: Link to show</br>      **questions**: Array of questions with this category</br>          **id**: Question ID</br>          **body**: Jeopardy! clue</br>          **response**: Jeopardy! answer</br>          **value**: Question dollar value; Final Jeopardy questions have 0 value</br>          **url**: Link to question
get.summary: Retrieve a single category by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of category to fetch

get.description: Use to retrieve all shows with three objects per page. </br> _Explanation of response attributes_</br> **shows**: Array of 3 shows</br>      **id**: ID of show</br>      **show_number**: Jeopardy! show number</br>      **air_date**: Date the show aired YYYY-MM-DD</br>      **categories**: Array of categories appearing in show</br>          **id**: ID of category</br>          **name**: Category name</br>          **url**: Link to category</br>      **rounds**: Array of rounds appearing in show</br>          **id**: ID of rounds</br>          **name**: Jeopardy!, Double Jeopardy! or Final Jeopardy!</br>          **url**: Link to round</br>          **questions**: Array of questions appearing in round</br>              **id**: ID of question</br>              **body**: Jeopardy! clue</br>              **response**: Jeopardy! answer</br>              **value**: Question dollar value; Final Jeopardy questions have 0 value</br>              **url**: Link to question</br>              **category**: Category of question</br>                  **id**: ID of category</br>                  **name**: Category name</br>                  **url**: link to category</br> **meta**: Information on pages</br>      **current_page**: Current page</br>      **next_page**: Next page, if available</br>      **prev_page**: Previous page, if available</br>      **total_pages**: Total number of pages</br>      **total_count**: Total number of Show objects

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Go to particular page. [Optional]

parameters.name: chrono_sort
parameters.description: "old" to sort in ascending chronological order, "recent" for descending. [Optional]

get.description: Use to retrieve one show by id </br> _Explanation of response attributes_</br> **show**</br>      **id**: ID of show</br>      **show_number**: Jeopardy! show number</br>      **air_date**: Date the show aired YYYY-MM-DD</br>      **categories**: Array of categories appearing in show</br>          **id**: ID of category</br>          **name**: Category name</br>          **url**: Link to category</br>      **rounds**: Array of rounds appearing in show</br>          **id**: ID of rounds</br>          **name**: Jeopardy!, Double Jeopardy! or Final Jeopardy!</br>          **url**: Link to round</br>          **questions**: Array of questions appearing in round</br>              **id**: ID of question</br>              **body**: Jeopardy! clue</br>              **response**: Jeopardy! answer</br>              **value**: Question dollar value; Final Jeopardy questions have 0 value</br>              **url**: Link to question</br>              **category**: Category of question</br>                  **id**: ID of category</br>                  **name**: Category name</br>                  **url**: link to category
get.summary: Retrieve a single show by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of show to fetch.
